newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton prices steady, mill demand low.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton prices steady, mill demand low.

text.p: Indian cotton prices held steady in a narrow trading range on Monday, dealers said.

They said mill demand fell while sentiment was subdued as traders anticapted a rise in new crop arrivals particularly from northern India. Reports of new crops arriving in the Gujarat region in the west also weakened market sentiment.

In spot deals long-staple Gujarat Sankar-4 was steady at 20,000/22,000 rupees per candy (355.56 kg). Bengal-deshi spot delivery was quiet at 835/850 rupees per maund, and so was Punjab saw-ginned at 1,670/1,675 rupees per maund.
